author: wired blogs
text: date: tue, 21 sep 1999 15:11:53 -0700 from: "matthew g. harrigan" (matth@mcr.com)to: (newsfeedback@wired.com)subject: an email bill for employeesi am writing in response to your article on the email bill ("we know what you did last fall," 21.sep.99). all davis' bill means is that the employer is required to notify the employee once, whichcould be in the form of an employment letter or contract. it doesn't mean that employersare required to tell employees the actual times they are being monitored. the bottom line is that people are going to say things in email that, if monitored,present the very realistic possibility of being misinterpreted. obviously, the jim jones thingwas a joke. obviously, this guy should not have been canned. obviously, no wording inhis contract would have prevented him from saying what he said. the notion that thistype of notification of monitoring will really have an impact is a complete joke.
